data.title: Gibson Flying V 2001 Cherry, USED
data.meta_description: The Gibson Flying V 2001 in Cherry is an iconic electric guitar known for its unique shape, powerful sound, and rock 'n' roll heritage. data.text:
The Gibson Flying V 2001 in Cherry is an iconic electric guitar known for its unique shape, powerful sound, and rock 'n' roll heritage. Here's an in-depth look at what makes this guitar special:

Distinctive Body Shape: The Gibson Flying V's striking V-shaped body has been a symbol of rock 'n' roll rebellion since its introduction in 1958. The 2001 Cherry model continues this legacy with a sleek, angular design that not only looks bold but also provides excellent balance and playability.

Mahogany Construction: The body and neck are crafted from solid mahogany, contributing to the guitar's rich, warm tone and impressive sustain. Mahogany is renowned for its resonance and depth, making it a favorite among guitarists who seek a full-bodied sound.

Cherry Finish: The vibrant Cherry finish enhances the natural grain of the mahogany wood, giving the Flying V a visually stunning appearance. This finish, combined with the guitar's unique shape, ensures that it stands out on any stage.

SlimTaper Neck Profile: The mahogany neck features Gibson's SlimTaper profile, which provides a comfortable and fast playing experience. This profile is designed for easy access to all frets, making it ideal for both rhythm and lead playing.

Rosewood Fingerboard: The rosewood fingerboard offers a smooth playing surface with a warm, rich tone. It includes 22 medium jumbo frets and dot inlays, providing a classic look and excellent playability.

Powerful Humbucking Pickups: The Flying V 2001 Cherry is equipped with Gibson's powerful humbucking pickups, known for their high output and versatility. These pickups deliver everything from smooth, clean tones to aggressive, overdriven sounds, making the guitar suitable for a wide range of musical styles.

Tune-O-Matic Bridge and Stopbar Tailpiece: The guitar features a Tune-O-Matic bridge and stopbar tailpiece, ensuring precise intonation and solid tuning stability. This setup also enhances the sustain and resonance of the instrument.

Classic Hardware: The chrome hardware, including Gibson Deluxe tuners, adds to the guitar's vintage aesthetic while providing reliable performance. These components are built to last and maintain their look over time.

Lightweight and Comfortable: Despite its bold appearance, the Flying V is relatively lightweight and comfortable to play. Its unique shape allows for easy access to the upper frets and provides a balanced feel when standing.

Vintage Appeal with Modern Reliability: The 2001 Cherry model combines the vintage appeal of the original Flying V with modern reliability and playability. This guitar is built to withstand the demands of live performance and studio recording.

In summary, the Gibson Flying V 2001 Cherry is a distinctive and powerful guitar that blends iconic design with exceptional performance. Its mahogany construction, versatile pickups, and striking appearance make it a standout choice for guitarists seeking a unique instrument with a rich rock 'n' roll heritage. Whether on stage or in the studio, the Flying V delivers the tone, playability, and style that have made it a legendary guitar for decades.
